title: Julia Child: The Woman Who Taught America to Cook

hook.text: Julia Child couldn't cook until age 36. By 50, she'd changed how 200 million Americans thought about food.

buildup.text: A tall, loud, ex-spy for the OSS, she moved to Paris in 1948 and fell in love with French food.

discovery.text: Her 1961 book 'Mastering the Art of French Cooking' made complex French techniques accessible to American homes.

punchline.text: She proved you don't need talent to cook. Just courage and butter.

quiz.question: What made Julia Child's TV show revolutionary?
options: It was unscripted and showed real, imperfect cooking
